Sentencas: The electrolyte of solid oxide fuel cells is generally a ceramic material whose inherent brittleness greatly limits its application.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under tensile loading

Sentencas: Understanding the fracture mechanism of electrolyte materials is an important issue to be resolved.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under tensile loading

Sentencas: In this study, the anisotropic deformation behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria (GDC) solid electrolytes is investigated by using the molecular dynamics method.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under tensile loading

Sentencas: When GDC is subject to uniaxial tensile loading, different fracture mechanisms are found in different crystal orientations.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under tensile loading

Sentencas: In the [100], [2 (1) over bar(1) over bar] crystal stretching process, phase transformation from fluorite to rutile occurs, while, in the [110] crystal orientation, multiple phase transformations are observed between fluorite and rutile structure, demonstrating the good loading capacity by a stress-induced transformation toughening mechanism.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under tensile loading

Sentencas: There is no phase transformation in the [111] crystal orientation, which exhibits brittle cleavage fracture owing to electrostatic repulsion of adjacent oxygen ion layers.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under tensile loading

Sentencas: Finally, the two-sided effects of temperature and doping concentration on different fracture mechanisms are analyzed.
Titulo: Anisotropic mechanical behavior of gadolinia-doped ceria solid electrolytes under tensile loading
